meanings.definition: Recognizably different in nature from something else.
meanings.sent1: The two flowers had distinct colors.
meanings.sent2: Her distinct voice made her easy to recognize.
meanings.sent3: The distinct smell of burnt popcorn filled the room.
meanings.sent4: His distinct style of painting set him apart from other artists.
meanings.sent5: The distinct sound of the train whistle echoed through the valley.

meanings.sent1: The distinct outline of the mountain was visible against the sky.
meanings.sent2: The distinct path through the forest was easy to follow.
meanings.sent3: She drew a distinct line in the sand to mark the boundary.
meanings.sent4: The distinct scent of fresh bread wafted from the bakery.
meanings.sent5: The distinct taste of the lemonade was refreshing on a hot day.

meanings.sent1: Each student had a distinct opinion on the topic.
meanings.sent2: The distinct flavors of the ice cream cone delighted her taste buds.
meanings.sent3: The distinct personalities of the twins made them easy to tell apart.
meanings.sent4: The distinct markings on the butterfly's wings were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The distinct patterns of the quilt showcased the artist's skill.
